meanings.definition: Not deserving of respect or approval.
meanings.sent1: The lazy student felt unworthy of praise.
meanings.sent2: She knew she was unworthy of the award.
meanings.sent3: The unworthy cat refused to catch any mice.
meanings.sent4: The unworthy tree shed its leaves in shame.
meanings.sent5: The unworthy beggar begged for forgiveness.

meanings.definition: Not having the qualities or abilities that merit recognition or consideration.
meanings.sent1: His unworthy attempt at singing made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent2: The broken toy was deemed unworthy of repair.
meanings.sent3: The unworthy cake collapsed in the oven.
meanings.sent4: The unworthy car sputtered and stalled on the road.
meanings.sent5: The unworthy pen ran out of ink during the exam.
